body_html:
@xqding I found your code snippet quite like this.
I know that https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/imagenet/main.py use Gloo as the default backend, just as the following code:
parser.add_argument('--dist-backend', default='gloo', type=str, help='distributed backend').

However, Gloo use TCP by default. I wonder how to use Gloo IBVERBS. Thanks.

@xqding I found your code snippet quite like [this](https://github.com/seba-1511/dist_tuto.pth/blob/gh-pages/train_dist.py).
I know that [https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/imagenet/main.py](https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/imagenet/main.py) use Gloo as the default backend, just as the following code:
`parser.add_argument('--dist-backend', default='gloo', type=str, help='distributed backend')`.

However, Gloo use TCP by default. I wonder how to use Gloo IBVERBS. Thanks.
